rolycoly.blurb: Rolycoly burns coal, but it produces even more. The extra output comes from a peat diet, but nobody knows where wild Rolycoly find the peat. Galarian environmental regulations keep citizens from depleting natural wetlands of their peat to feed household Rolycoly.

rolycoly.name: Carkol
rolycoly.blurb: Carkol tops 60mph when it finds tracks. Mine tracks are sized according to the Carkol Standard, to make sure they’re always appropriate. These tracks help Carkol get around at high speed, but also keep the Pokémon from going where it’s not wanted.

rolycoly.name: Coalossal
rolycoly.blurb: Coalossal are territorial, but don’t battle to decide which must leave. Instead, Coalossal compare the quality of their coal by its smoke, energy output, and heat. Whichever Coalossal makes better coal gets to stay, with others leaving peacefully for mines with less competition.

applin.name: Applin
applin.blurb: Applin’s egg decomposes just a day or two after it hatches. The egg is full of nutrients that fruit trees love, growing more apples to hide in. Farmers let Applin steal away as many apples as it wants because of this, and even try to attract Applin to their orchards for a better crop.

applin.name: Flapple
applin.blurb: Flapple guards its evolution orchard ferociously, letting no Fire- or Bug-Types near. Because Bug-Types are its primary prey, Flapple must leave to eat. They never leave for long, so farmers with a rogue Flapple don’t have time to properly harvest their orchard.

applin.name: Appletun
applin.blurb: Appletun sheds its skin once a month. People used to eat this skin as is, but modern health regulations state you should rinse it thoroughly. Chefs use the skin in all sorts of recipes, so a busy Chef may have an entire team of Appletun to never be left understocked.

silicobra.name: Silicobra
silicobra.blurb: If Silicobra accidentally buries itself into a Durant tunnel, it fills the tunnel with all of its pouch’s sand and runs away. This angers the entire colony, but generally Durant don’t know how the sand got there.

silicobra.name: Sandaconda
silicobra.blurb: Sandaconda’s scale pattern lets it hide in tall grass to avoid conflict. This is especially useful when it sees predators like Corviknight flying overhead, which don’t care about its sandstorms. Some swear they’ve seen 30 feet of coils slithering through the tall grass.

cramorant.name: Cramorant
cramorant.blurb: Ancient fishers trained Cramorant to dive where Arrokuda lives and spit the fish back up onto a waiting fisherman’s net. These days, people prefer to eat fish that Cramorant didn’t get to taste first.

arrokuda.name: Arrokuda
arrokuda.blurb: Arrokuda launch at top speed at prey without discerning what it is beforehand. The launch force can send targets clear out of the water, so swimmers in Arrokuda waters must be especially careful. In any Galar town where Arrokuda live, you’ll also find bulletproof wetsuits for sale.

arrokuda.name: Barraskewda
arrokuda.blurb: At its top speed, Barraskewda’s tail propels the Pokémon so fast that it sucks in everything within a 5ft radius. Some scavenger Pokémon live entirely off of Barraskewda’s trail of destruction.

toxel.name: Toxel
toxel.blurb: The rumors you heard in middle school are false: licking a Toxel will only get you a trip to the hospital and a weeklong stomachache.

toxel.name: Toxtricity
toxel.blurb:
Ancient images of Toxtricity lay all over Galar. Until recently, archaeologists theorized that Toxtricity was one of the Giganto Beasts that rampaged in the Darkest Day. The discovery of new ancient “zine” documents suggest these images may actually be fan creations.
Pokéfeature: Amped Form Toxtricity can choose Moody for its Level 5 feature. Low Key can choose Own Tempo. In levels with Moves separated by “ / “, Amped Form learns the first and Low Key the second.

sizzlipede.name: Sizzlipede
sizzlipede.blurb: Sizzlipede hunt by sensing vibrations in the ground. Corvisquire have learned to take advantage of this and tap the ground to simulate panicked prey. When Sizzlipede appear, Corvisquire snatch them up by the pound.

sizzlipede.name: Centiskorch
sizzlipede.blurb: Centiscorch burrow deep underground when it’s time to nest, creating large dens of 10 or more. If these dens form under a body of water, they create hot springs.

clobbopus.name: Clobbopus
clobbopus.blurb: Clobbopus’ clublike hands are too slow to battle prey underwater, despite adapting from aquatic species. It swims peacefully beneath the surface until it is hungry enough to crawl up on land.

clobbopus.name: Grapploct
clobbopus.blurb: Grapploct always make Top 5 or higher in “Most Aggressive Pokémon” in The Analysis Scene Zine, but they aren’t considered dangerous. Despite being master battlers, Grapploct proudly leave when opponents admits defeat.

sinistea.name: Sinistea
sinistea.blurb: Sinistea cannot hold its shape without a container. It spills like a liquid from the center of wherever it is placed. If its cup breaks, Sinistea will reform in the nearest available cup-like object.

sinistea.name: Polteageist
sinistea.blurb: Polteageist that grow too big for its teapot (physically or emotionally) will search for a bigger home. In fall, you may see many Polteageist line up by a discarded piece of china. When a Polteageist of the right size enters the new pot, they all scramble to swap their old ones.

hatenna.name: Hatenna
hatenna.blurb: Its emotional instability is hard to handle for other Hatenna, so they don’t herd in the wild. They shuffle quietly along the forest floor alone, uncomfortable with most Pokémons’ enthusiasm. It can’t sense the emotions of Dark-Types, so Hatenna can get along quite well with them.

hatenna.name: Hattrem
hatenna.blurb: Hattrem uses psychic powers to control its hair as a cudgel, bashing whole trees down to get at berries. 90% of its diet goes to growing new hair. Older Trainers say the only emotion Hattrem will put up with is laughter, but Pokéologists consider this too dangerous to test.

hatenna.name: Hatterene
hatenna.blurb: You can feel wild Hatterenes’ presence long before you see them. The headaches it causes last for days unless treated with strong tea, and only get worse if you become emotional. Only Dark-Types can live nearby without suffering, making these forests even more dangerous.

impidimp.name: Impidimp
impidimp.blurb: Impidimp doesn’t care what happens to what it stole after getting caught. If nobody notices their objects are missing, Impidimp even gets flustered and returns twice what it originally stole. As obnoxiously as possible, of course, as it wants attention more than lost keys or socks.

impidimp.name: Morgrem
impidimp.blurb: Although tricky, it’s tradition to hunt Morgrem for their large treasure hordes. Supposedly, if you catch one by the toes and hang it upside down, its hair cannot help but point towards home. Nothing else Morgrem does can be trusted.

impidimp.name: Grimmsnarl
impidimp.blurb: If Grimmsnarl is left to its own devices, its hair will just keep growing. After a certain length, the hair becomes uncontrollable by Grimmsnarl itself. At this point, Grimmsnarl will attack strong Pokémon just to lose its hair in the violence.

milcery.name: Milcery
milcery.blurb: Milcery appears when the scents of two Alcremie walk through the same area. Every once in a while, it can also appear when an Alcremie walks past a particularly skilled bakery. These Alcremy have an especially distinct look, and bakeries pay top dollar to have one caught.

milcery.name: Alcremie
milcery.blurb: Every once in a while, Alcremie will spin to bake berries within its stomach into treats. These fresh-baked berries are ten times as nutritious and give Alcremie its signature smell. Trainers who register Alcremie in league battles are forbidden to feed them common allergens.

falinks.name: Falinks
falinks.blurb: The theory that Falinks possess latent psychic powers was debunked at the turn of the century. Their zealous training is what coordinates them to the point of acting as a single creature. They will follow orders from the leading link even if those orders make no sense at all.

pincurchin.name: Pincurchin
pincurchin.blurb: Pincurchin’s spines make excellent conductors even when not emitting electricity. These spines grow in a fivefold symmetry pattern, and noticeably warm nearby water. Its tendency to burrow into the sand when not feeding has embarrassed many swimmers.

snom.name: Snom
snom.blurb: Everstones always sell out in Circhester Town, due to Snom’s popularity. If a Snom wants to evolve, they’re known to throw Everstones away into the local hot spring. This may be the origin of the Circhester phrase, “Growth and comfort bathe apart.”

snom.name: Frosmoth
snom.blurb: Frosmoth was revered as a mountain spirit that protected villages. While younger folks no longer believe the myths, people still hang harvests on their shutters after the first snow: wheat, or local variants Postwick potatoes and Ballonlea sugar beets.

stonjourner.name: Stonjourner
stonjourner.blurb: There are Stonjourner in many regions, not just Galar. The dates for each region’s herd gathering are all different, but they almost all form circles as a ritual. The exception to this behavior is Sinnoh, where Stonjourner gather to form an eighteen-point star.

eiscue.name: Eiscue
eiscue.blurb: Eiscue’s ice block is surprisingly heavy, as much as fifty pounds. The block is structured to shatter completely on impact, so Eiscue doesn’t feel any force. Automotive companies copy this structure in vehicle bodies to make crashes safer.

eiscue.name: Eiscue (Noice)
eiscue.blurb: Although Eiscue’s worried face is beloved by most people, Trainers view it as a mid-battle danger symbol. With its weighted block gone, Eiscue goes all out in a panic to finish the fight as soon as possible.

indeedee.name: Indeedee (♂)
indeedee.blurb: Indeedee have extremely high standards for themselves, and will repeat a task until it’s done to their liking. Complicated tasks can frustrate it, so Trainers are recommended to break elaborate orders into simpler blocks so it can focus.

indeedee.name: Indeedee (♀)
indeedee.blurb: When Audino and Indeedee meet, absolutely nothing gets done. They both try to make life easier for the other Pokémon, but refuse any help from the other. This will repeat until another person or Pokémon intervenes.

morpeko.name: Morpeko
morpeko.blurb: When Morpeko gets hungry, even berries don’t leave it satisfied. It only feels better after eating a special nut Morpeko carries in its pouches. If a Trainer runs out of the nut, Morpeko will throw a tantrum for days before tiring itself out.

cufant.name: Cufant
cufant.blurb: There are more nerve endings in Cufant’s trunk than the rest of its body combined. Cufant studies objects by gripping them with its trunk and rotating them endlessly, letting go when its curiosity is satisfied. With its grip strength, practically nothing can interrupt this process.

cufant.name: Copperajah
cufant.blurb: Copperajah are too heavy to swim, but their migration routes cross many rivers. To overcome this, Copperajah walk on the bottom and hold their trunk above the water’s surface. Copperajah can walk underwater all day this way, resurfacing miles away from where they started.

dracozolt.name: Dracozolt
dracozolt.blurb: Although Dracozolt primarily ate plants, it has sharp teeth and binocular vision. These adaptations let it chase down and attack ancient Grass-Types like Tangrowth, making it an apex herbivore.

arctozolt.name: Arctozolt
arctozolt.blurb: Arctozolt constantly moved between warm shallow water and colder land. Its body adapted to be only mildly uncomfortable in either environment, to hunt its fastest prey: Lileep.

dracovish.name: Dracovish
dracovish.blurb: In heavy rain, Dracovish could stand up out of water with no trouble. During these times, no other ancient species were safe. The only thing that could stop Dracovish was Kabutops, its natural predator.

arctovish.name: Arctovish
arctovish.blurb: To eat bottom-dwelling Omanyte, Arctovish would freeze water until frozen blocks of prey floated to the surface. It could then eat at what passes for an Arctovish’s leisure.

duraludon.name: Duraludon
duraludon.blurb: Duraludon pulverizes gemstones with its specially-shaped claws. It uses the powder to clean its alloy armor in place of water. Gemstones are Tyranitar’s second favorite food, so it attacks Duraludon on sight. One way or the other, the battles never last long.

dreepy.name: Dreepy
dreepy.blurb: Do not let their size fool you; Dreepy hunger for battle as any Dragon does. They love lurking in the shadow of a strong Pokémon, then provoking others around it to watch the ensuing fight.

dreepy.name: Drakloak
dreepy.blurb: Drakloak chases anything bigger than itself out of its territory, but gladly takes care of any small Pokémon almost as well as their own child. This instinct kicks in even when the ‘smaller’ companion is older and stronger.

dreepy.name: Dragapult
dreepy.blurb: Although Dragapult’s method of evolution is nothing special, you’ll almost never see one in the wild. That doesn’t mean it isn’t around. Dragapult is so fast and sneaky that it can protect its kin without ever being noticed.

zacian.name: Zacian
zacian.blurb:
Zacian battled at the Fairy King’s side for the king’s entire life. When the king died, Zacian walked into the mists to mourn and was not seen again for a hundred years.
Pokéfeature: Zacian cannot Dynamax.

zacian.name: Zacian (Crowned Sword)
zacian.blurb: Zacian’s eternal blade is so heavy that no other Pokémon could lift it an inch off the ground. Legends say that Zacian stayed by the Iron King’s side until the king entered an unjust war. Zacian turned to stone and slept as its home became mired in violence.

zamazenta.name: Zamazenta
zamazenta.blurb:
Zamazenta trained the Fighting Master until the master could beat any opponent. When the Fighting Master finally broke through Zamazenta’s shield, the master left to become a king.
Pokéfeature: Zamazenta cannot Dynamax.

zamazenta.name: Zamazenta (Crowned Shield)
zamazenta.blurb: Zamazenta’s shield is so strong that it was said to stop the ocean itself. Legends say that Zamazenta drew the channel between Kalos and Galar to keep them from fighting over territory.

eternatus.name: Eternatus
eternatus.blurb:
Eternatus is the origin of the Dynamax phenomenon unique to Galar. While it cannot Dynamax naturally, it uses the illusory and spacetime-warping powers of Galar particles fluently to appear gigantic before all.
Pokéfeature: Eternatus cannot Dynamax.

eternatus.name: Eternatus (Eternamax)
eternatus.blurb:
The being that caused the Darkest Day, the catastrophic event that shaped Galar’s ancient and modern history alike. It’s hypothesized that Eternatus can freely manipulate Galar particles because they are still part of its form.
Pokéfeature: Eternamax Eternatus can use Max Moves.

kubfu.name: Kubfu
kubfu.blurb:
Although Kubfu’s body is more powerful than Tyrogue’s, when the two meet Tyrogue is always the teacher. Kubfu learns from Tyrogue’s tenacity and determination, admiring the small monster as a sensei. Whether these traits sink in is up to the individual.
Pokéfeature: Kubfu can learn the Moves Surging Strikes or Wicked Blow from a source determined by the GM.

kubfu.name: Urshifu (Single Strike)

evolves.by: Know Wicked Blow and level up

kubfu.blurb: Urshifu’s new techniques draw from its anger, but it cannot let that turn into hatred. An Urshifu who gives into cruelty is considered a regional emergency, and its entire mountain is considered a Raid Den until defeated.

kubfu.name: Urshifu (Rapid Strike)

evolves.by: Know Surging Strikes and level up

kubfu.blurb: Although Urshifu’s new techniques are unpredictable to the untrained eye, Urshifu can only afford to change its attacks so wildly because it has trained them all to the point of routine. On good days, Urshifu begins its next attack before the Trainer has time to call it out.

zarude.name: Zarude
zarude.blurb: Zarude forests grow so dense over time that even other Pokémon can’t make their way through. Because of this, Zarude’s environment has only been officially recorded a handful of times. Poachers and Pokéologists alike pay handsomely for information on a Zarude pack’s home.

calyrex.name: Calyrex
calyrex.blurb:
Calyrex’s name was erased from history when a spiteful king wanted to assert their divine right over the land. Only a northern village kept the truth safely hidden. That village’s crops were the most bountiful in the kingdom until the spiteful king razed their fields.
Pokéfeature: Calyrex can ride willing Pokemon to create a Rider form. Rider forms have their own movesets.

calyrex.name: Calyrex (Ice Rider)
calyrex.blurb: Glastrier was tamed through compassion and mercy. After riding Glastrier for three days and nights, Calyrex was beaten and bruised. Calyrex used its power to heal Glastrier instead of itself, and the horse never bucked again.

calyrex.name: Calyrex (Shadow Rider)
calyrex.blurb: Spectrier’s pride never diminished, and it would go on to challenge Calyrex one hundred times over the king’s reign. When the people’s faith diminished and Calyrex’s strength grew weak, Spectrier was the last to leave.

glastrier.name: Glastrier
glastrier.blurb: Before Calyrex, Glastrier was a force of destruction that took no sides. Ruins of its path still litter Galar, indistinguishable from those burned down by war and greed.

spectrier.name: Spectrier
spectrier.blurb: Before Calyrex, Spectrier terrorized Galar with its mischief. It loved to rot fruits and vegetables away by stealing life from their roots, turning entire fields wilted as it ran by. When there was no food to ruin, it would chase people within their dreams.
